sentences.en: &B{I put} him clean &B{out of countenance} just by looking at him.
sentences.cn: 我只是看着他，就让他非常不安。

sentences.en: A merry heart makes a cheerful countenance.
All colour drained from her countenance.
At the sight of this photograph he changed his countenance.
sentences.cn: 他一看见这张照片脸色就变了.

sentences.en: He looked so funny that I found it difficult to keep my countenance.
sentences.cn: 他的样子非常滑稽,我难以忍住不笑.

sentences.en: He possesses a mild and benevolent countenance.
Her countenance is like the flowers and the moon.
His countenance was illuminated with a look of pleasure.
sentences.cn: 他的脸上泛起喜悦的光彩.

sentences.en: I am surprised ( to learn that ) you give countenance to such conduct.
sentences.cn: 我惊讶的是你竟赞成这种做法.

sentences.en: I made a fierce countenance as if I would eat him alive.
sentences.cn: 我脸色恶狠狠地,仿佛要把他活生生地吞下去.

sentences.en: Jake would not countenance Janis's marrying while still a student.
sentences.cn: 杰克不会同意贾尼斯还在上学就结婚。

sentences.en: Sam looked after Mr. Johnson with a sullen countenance.
sentences.cn: 塞姆闷闷不乐地目送着约翰逊先生.

sentences.en: The committee refused to countenance his proposals.
sentences.cn: 委员会拒不同意他的方案。

sentences.en: There was joy in his speech and countenance.
They would not countenance our suggestion.
sentences.cn: 他们不会批准我们的建议.

sentences.en: to keep herself in countenance she opened her notebook.
sentences.cn: 为保持镇定，她打开了笔记本。

sentences.en: When Tom's companions drank to the Hans en Kelderr, or Jack in the low cellar , he could not help displaying an extraordinary complacence of countenance.
sentences.cn: 当同事们举杯向他祝贺那未出世的孩子时, 汤姆不禁露出一种异常得意的神情.

sentences.en: Whispers passed along , and a boding uneasiness took possession of every countenance.
sentences.cn: 到处窃窃私语,人人脸上露出不祥的焦虑.

phrases.tran_cn: （尤指忍住不笑）不动声色；保持镇定

trans.tran_cn: 表情，脸，面孔，赞同，支持，鼓励

trans.tran_en: to accept, support, or approve of something
